instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
this came in botched from another store without smc.
Replaced smc, and i got green light now., but board still not turning on.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> : 2.9v ( strange )
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : 2.9v ( strange too)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.6v
I have tried replacing tps, but still no luck.
any pointer ? thanks..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> gets hot?
Check <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR>/70 ohm values and resolder all around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.
What about RTC signals?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
the whole board is cool.
u7200justtt a bittt of warm.
<RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR> is 5k ohm each.
all around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> itself has been resoldered and rock solid.

all around <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> is perfect too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
You cannot propely check the resistor value onboard.
If needed, play with RC/RD divider, until get correct <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
hmm.
i tried to play with rc rd, at first, I wire <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR>, but I got 2v.
i thought, ok, lowering resistance give me lower value, lets replace with higher rating resistor. so I gave 15k ohm resistor to <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR>.
but voltage is like 200mv.
Im confused.

for <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR>, from board view its connected to ground. but according to schematic, theres no ground on either pin 1/2 of <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR>.
so I tried to wire it, but voltage is gone, so I replace <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR> back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
According to SCHEMATIC, pin 2/<RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR> goes to ground through XW7201.

The formula from the schematic shows that increasing <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR> (RC) value, will increase VOUT (<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
hi, can we start over ?
i dont have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> now, I have put everything back.
I have <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, but <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0v.
<SIGNAL>P5V3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL> is present, but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> isnt present. is it because of missing s5 pwrgd ?
I have tried replacing <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is a power good signal, which will come high ONLY when <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present.

Replaca <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR>/70 and check all solders and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
i see..
replaced  <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR> to original value. and back to square one. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 2.9-3.0v
any advice for <RESISTOR>R7270</RESISTOR> value ? is 100k too much ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
What do you expect, increasing from 6.5K to 100K (15x aprox)???
Try 7.5-8.2K...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
i try 8.2k, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 3.0v.
still not enough i think, if i use 15k, the voltage is gone ( 0v)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
You may have broken traces now.
Check if <RESISTOR>R7269</RESISTOR> is still OK (10K).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
THANKSSS A LOTTT!!
Pin 9 of <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> to <RESISTOR>R7220</RESISTOR> is actually broken, the broken trace is camouflaged so well.
you told me to check, so i have to do it with resistance mode to all trace.
when i see resistance so huge, turn out there's small crater.
i will be more careful next time, thanks a lot!!
